meanings.definition: Serving as a typical example or model
meanings.sent1: The red apple is prototypical of all apples.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior was prototypical of a good student.
meanings.sent3: His love for ice cream is prototypical; he eats it every day!
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood prototypical in the center of the park.
meanings.sent5: The cozy fireplace was prototypical of a warm and inviting home.

meanings.definition: Original or first of a kind
meanings.sent1: The prototypical car had four wheels and a steering wheel.
meanings.sent2: The Wright brothers' airplane was prototypical in aviation history.
meanings.sent3: The chef's new dish was prototypical; it combined flavors never seen before.
meanings.sent4: Her novel idea was prototypical, sparking a wave of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was prototypical, revealing a lost civilization.
